name: TheAtlantic
text: In this week's "Dear Therapist," @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader who is struggling to get through the holiday season after her parents' divorce several years ago. https://t.co/03xkcY3QSB

name: TheAtlantic
text: It might be tempting to try to draw meaning from a rare cosmic conjunction—but first, go outside tonight and see Jupiter and Saturn, @marinakoren writes. https://t.co/DBQGh4Qp5i

name: TheAtlantic
text: Zoom will not make public transit obsolete, @JSadikKhan and @SethSolomonow predict. "In post-pandemic America," they write, "restoring transit will be as essential as restoring power lines, water mains, and roads after a natural or economic disaster." https://t.co/yO5Nv319hL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Some evidence has suggested that taking melatonin could help slow COVID-19. But the real key may be sleep itself, @jameshamblin reports: https://t.co/NM6aAxccIL

name: TheAtlantic
text: Today is #NationalCrosswordPuzzleDay. Earlier this year, we expanded our puzzles to the weekend and launched a new feature that allows you to play with friends. If you’re inspired to join our crossword-puzzle community, here are some tips for beginners: https://t.co/2UVPlhHZfg

name: TheAtlantic
text:
RT @JeffreyGoldberg: "Biden does not yet appear to have defined the limits of Kerry’s role and explained how it will be integrated into the broader strategy. This has some of Biden’s other advisers worried." -- @thomaswright08:
https://t.co/mhPD74Rw33

name: TheAtlantic
text: The president’s refusal to accept the outcome of the election will leave a dangerous legacy. The latest Atlantic Daily, by @mimbsy: https://t.co/aIJEv5sNuM

name: TheAtlantic
text: Sign up for the newsletter here: https://t.co/ZY4adCYUKG

name: TheAtlantic
text: August Wilson produced digressive plays rich in African American history and ritual that didn’t slot neatly into mainstream expectations. @pollackpelzner on two new films that honor the playwright’s rebellion: https://t.co/uWktpQFGOM

name: TheAtlantic
text: The nation’s largest city overwhelmingly approved a referendum to adopt ranked-choice voting a year ago. Now some elected leaders are trying to delay the reform, @russellberman reports: https://t.co/OHnpLdfAPn

name: TheAtlantic
text: John Kerry "has the stature and ability to redefine America’s climate diplomacy, which the country sorely needs, but he will succeed only if his role is integrated into a broader strategy and doesn’t contradict or undermine it," @thomaswright08 writes: https://t.co/U0z4eLWNBq

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @Saahil_Desai: "Everyone is at the mercy of the virus; it doesn’t discriminate by race or class or gender or age. And yet, from the very beginning of the pandemic, the virus has exposed and targeted all of the disparities that come along with being Black in America" https://t.co/ABChkwo5ra

name: TheAtlantic
text: From the very beginning of the pandemic, the coronavirus has targeted and exposed all of the disparities that come along with being Black in America, writes @SpeakPatrice. https://t.co/lHmiQPCTK5

name: TheAtlantic
text: Justin Sullivan, a staff photographer with Getty Images, covered nearly the full spectrum of U.S. news stories in 2020: the early days of the pandemic, protests, wildfires, and the election. Stories brought to us through his lens, via @theAtlPhoto: https://t.co/GfX2OGme0X https://t.co/JfC6DyCaeC
